variables.description: The CIDR address block used for the destination match. For example, "0.0.0.0/0".                   Routing decisions are based on the most specific match.
variables.name: DestinationCidrBlock

variables.description: The ID of an Internet gateway or virtual private gateway that is attached to                   your VPC. For example: "igw-eaad4883".
variables.name: GatewayId
variables.required: Conditional. You must specify only one of the                   following properties: GatewayId, InstanceId,                      NetworkInterfaceId, or VpcPeeringConnectionId.

variables.description: The ID of a NAT instance in your VPC. For example, "i-1a2b3c4d".
variables.name: InstanceId
variables.required: Conditional. You must specify only one of the                   following properties: GatewayId, InstanceId,                      NetworkInterfaceId, or VpcPeeringConnectionId.

variables.description: Allows the routing of network interface IDs.
variables.name: NetworkInterfaceId
variables.required: Conditional. You must specify only one of the                   following properties: GatewayId, InstanceId,                      NetworkInterfaceId, or VpcPeeringConnectionId.

variables.description: The ID of the route table where the route will                   be added.
variables.name: RouteTableId

variables.description: The ID of a VPC peering connection.
variables.name: VpcPeeringConnectionId
variables.required: Conditional. You must specify only one of the                   following properties: GatewayId, InstanceId,                      NetworkInterfaceId, or VpcPeeringConnectionId.
